at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.stm32

Class RMCSComponentManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.stm32.RMCSComponentManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class RMCSComponentManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The central manager that handles all incoming IData and, depending on the type of data, forwards it to the corresponding SensorDataListeners and RMCSControlComponents.
    All RMCSControlComponents have to register themselves with the RMCSComponentManager in order to get updated about new IControlData.
    All SensorDataListeners have to register themselves with the RMCSComponentManager in order to get updated about new SensorData.
    Author:
    Boeck

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Collection<RMCSControlComponent> carComponents
      The list of RMCSControlComponents that the RMCSComponentManager updates about new IControlData.
      private java.util.Collection<SensorDataListener> dataListeners
      The list of SensorDataListeners that the RMCSComponentManager updates about new SensorData.
      private java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<IData> dataQueue
      The Queue, that SensorDataListeners and RMCSControlComponents put new Data on, that should be distributed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addCarComponent(RMCSControlComponent carComponent)
      Adds the given RMCSControlComponent to carComponents, if the passed object is not null.
      boolean addDataListener(ISensorDataListener listener, java.util.Collection<EDataType> listenerTypes)
      Creates a new SensorDataListener with the given parameters and adds it to dataListeners, unless a SensorDataListener with the given ISensorDataListener is already in dataListeners, in which case the passed EDataTypes are merely added to the list of EDataTypes of the SensorDataListener that contains the passed ISensorDataListener.
      boolean addDataListener(ISensorDataListener listener, EDataType listenerType)
      Creates a new SensorDataListener with the given parameters and adds it to dataListeners, unless a SensorDataListener with the given ISensorDataListener is already in dataListeners, in which case the passed EDataType is merely added to the list of EDataTypes of the SensorDataListener that contains the passed ISensorDataListener.
      boolean addDataListener(SensorDataListener listener)
      Adds the given SensorDataListener to dataListeners, if the passed object is not null.
      boolean removeCarComponent(RMCSControlComponent carComponent)
      Removes the given RMCSControlComponent from carComponents.
      boolean removeDataListener(ISensorDataListener listener)
      Removes the SensorDataListener with the given ISensorDataListener from dataListeners.
      boolean removeDataListener(ISensorDataListener listener, java.util.Collection<EDataType> listenerTypes)
      Removes the passed EDataTypes from the SensorDataListener with the given ISensorDataListener from dataListeners.
      boolean removeDataListener(ISensorDataListener listener, EDataType listenerType)
      Removes the passed EDataType from the SensorDataListener with the given ISensorDataListener from dataListeners.
      boolean removeDataListener(SensorDataListener listener)
      Removes the passed SensorDataListener from dataListeners.
      void run()
      Continuously waits for data on the dataQueue and distributes that data to the correct RMCSControlComponents and SensorDataListeners, depending on what type of data they can process.

      • addDataListener

        public boolean addDataListener(SensorDataListener listener)
        Adds the given SensorDataListener to dataListeners, if the passed object is not null.
        Parameters:
        listener - the ISensorDataListener to be added to dataListeners.
        Returns:
        true, if dataListeners changed as a result of the call of this method, otherwise false.

      • addDataListener

        public boolean addDataListener(ISensorDataListener listener,
                               EDataType listenerType)
        Creates a new SensorDataListener with the given parameters and adds it to dataListeners, unless a SensorDataListener with the given ISensorDataListener is already in dataListeners, in which case the passed EDataType is merely added to the list of EDataTypes of the SensorDataListener that contains the passed ISensorDataListener.
        Parameters:
        listener - the ISensorDataListener that wants to be informed about new SensorData.
        listenerType - the type of SensorData that the listener wants to be informed about.
        Returns:
        true, if dataListeners or an object contained in dataListeners changed as a result of the call of this method, otherwise false.

      • addDataListener

        public boolean addDataListener(ISensorDataListener listener,
                               java.util.Collection<EDataType> listenerTypes)
        Creates a new SensorDataListener with the given parameters and adds it to dataListeners, unless a SensorDataListener with the given ISensorDataListener is already in dataListeners, in which case the passed EDataTypes are merely added to the list of EDataTypes of the SensorDataListener that contains the passed ISensorDataListener.
        Parameters:
        listener - the ISensorDataListener that wants to be informed about new SensorData.
        listenerTypes - the list of types of SensorData that the listener wants to be informed about.
        Returns:
        true, if dataListeners or an element thereof changed as a result of the call of this method, otherwise false.

      • removeDataListener

        public boolean removeDataListener(SensorDataListener listener)
        Removes the passed SensorDataListener from dataListeners.
        Parameters:
        listener - the SensorDataListener to be removed.
        Returns:
        true, if dataListeners changed as a result of the call of this method, otherwise false.

      • removeDataListener

        public boolean removeDataListener(ISensorDataListener listener,
                                  EDataType listenerType)
        Removes the passed EDataType from the SensorDataListener with the given ISensorDataListener from dataListeners.
        Parameters:
        listener - the ISensorDataListener that wants to stop receiving updates about a certain type of SensorData.
        listenerType - the type of SensorData that the listener doesn't want to be updated about anymore.
        Returns:
        true, if an element of dataListeners changed as a result of the call of this method, otherwise false.

      • removeDataListener

        public boolean removeDataListener(ISensorDataListener listener,
                                  java.util.Collection<EDataType> listenerTypes)
        Removes the passed EDataTypes from the SensorDataListener with the given ISensorDataListener from dataListeners.
        Parameters:
        listener - the ISensorDataListener that wants to stop receiving updates about a certain type of SensorData.
        listenerTypes - the list of types of SensorData that the listener doesn't want to be updated about anymore.
        Returns:
        true, if an element of dataListeners changed as a result of the call of this method, otherwise false.

      • removeDataListener

        public boolean removeDataListener(ISensorDataListener listener)
        Removes the SensorDataListener with the given ISensorDataListener from dataListeners.
        Parameters:
        listener - the SensorDataListener to be removed.
        Returns:
        true, if dataListeners changed as a result of the call of this method, otherwise false.

      • run

        public void run()
        Continuously waits for data on the dataQueue and distributes that data to the correct RMCSControlComponents and SensorDataListeners, depending on what type of data they can process.
